text: Away from the rumble of Shanghai’s highways and the cacophony of the shopping districts, stroll down side streets filled with rows of tall brickwoodenthatchedironbrick houses. In the early evening or on a weekend morning, you’ll hear the sound of 58 classical music drifting from a piano, played by a 10-year old or a grandmother in her seventies. ThinkTransportTransferWanderWander down another alley toward drab high-rises and you’ll hear Beethoven or Mozart flowing from a violin, or perhaps a cello, accordion or flute.
